usefulItems: baking tray and baking paper, fine sieve, serving bowl, oven
title: Quinoa Salad with Butternut Squash, Spinach and Pomegranate

ingredients.content: 400 g butternut squash, peeled, cut in pieces (5 cm)
2 spring onions, cut in pieces (3 cm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C and line a large baking tray with baking paper.

Place butternut squash in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>3 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Spread out over prepared baking tray, drizzle with oil and 1 Tbsp honey then scatter 1 tsp salt over the top. Roast for 20-25 minutes (180°C) until golden brown. Meanwhile, rinse and dry mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
Place almonds in mixing bowl and chop <b>1 min/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place another bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in quinoa then rinse using a fine sieve.
Place rinsed quinoa, water, ½ tsp salt and pepper in mixing bowl then cook <b>15 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Meanwhile wash baby spinach and spin dry, then set aside.
Transfer cooked quinoa to a large serving bowl and stir with spatula to separate grains. Leave to stand for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare dressing.

Place walnut oil, lemon juice, spring onions, mint and ½ Tbsp honey in mixing bowl then mix <b>5 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>5 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Pour dressing over quinoa and mix well.
Stir in baby spinach, pomegranate seeds and chopped almonds. Season to taste then arrange roasted squash on top and serve.

hintsAndTricks: Use other varieties of squash for different flavours, textures and colours.
